page.title: 12Dairy farm rural Wor'shire
page.content: Old farm, originally known as "Brick hole farm", dating from the 17th or 18th century, is a small family run dairy farm covering 65 acres. It is situtaed 4 miles from Alvechurch and 4 miles from Redditch. the farm is run by the farmer and his wife with occasional help from their 2 tennage sons,. Old farm has 62 animals, 39 of which are friesian cows kept for their milk, the remainder include Aberdeen angus ad a few Hereford calves. The cows are milked twice a day at 7.30am and 6.30pm, four cowes being milked at a time in the tandem miling parlour. Each cow produces an average yield of 7 callons of milk each day but a good cow may give up to 10 gallons. The cows are given cow cake to eat whilt they are being milked, the amount being determined by the amount they usually produce. A tanker collects
